Text: I waited patiently for the LORD; He turned to me and heard my cry.
Context: David begins with a declaration of trust and experience of God's rescue.

Text: He lifted me out of the slimy pit, out of the mud and mire; He set my feet on a rock and made my footing firm.
Context: David recalls the deliverance from a desperate situation, symbolized by a pit.

Text: He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear, and put their trust in the LORD.
Context: The transformation from despair to joy results in a testimony that influences others.

Text: Blessed is the man who makes the LORD his trust, who does not turn to the proud, to those who go astray after false gods.
Context: The psalm expresses a beatitude for those who rely on God instead of human or false sources.

Text: Many, O LORD my God, are the wonders You have done, and the plans You have for us—none can compare to You. I will proclaim and tell of them, though they are too many to count.
Context: David reflects on the innumerable deeds and plans of God, expressing anticipation for what God will do.

Text: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire, but my ears You have opened. Burnt offering and sin offering You did not require.
Context: David touches on the inadequacy of ritual without obedience, instead highlighting the need to listen to God.

Text: Then I said, “Here I am, I have come— it is written about me in the scroll.
Context: David submits to God's will, acknowledging that his role is part of God's plan as revealed in the Scriptures.

Text: I delight to do Your will, O my God; Your law is within my heart.”
Context: David declares his joy in following God's will, indicating that it is internalized rather than external obligation.

Text: I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; see, I do not seal my lips, as You know, O LORD.
Context: David commits to boldly proclaiming God's righteousness despite potential risks or fears.

Text: I have not covered up Your righteousness in my heart; I have spoken of Your faithfulness and salvation. I have not hidden Your love and Your truth from the great assembly.
Context: David emphasizes his openness in declaring God's attributes, even when it might cause personal anguish.

Text: Do not withhold Your mercy from me, O LORD; may Your love and Your truth always protect me.
Context: David expresses confidence in God's steadfast love and truth as his protection.

Text: For troubles without number surround me; my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart fails within me.
Context: David describes the overwhelming nature of his troubles and his own sinfulness, resulting in a plea for help.

Text: Be pleased, O LORD, to save me; O LORD, come quickly to help me.
Context: A direct appeal to God for salvation and prompt assistance in the midst of despair.

Text: May all who seek to take my life be put to shame and confusion; may all who desire my ruin be turned back in disgrace.
Context: David calls for the defeat and humiliation of those who wish him harm.

Text: May those who say to me, “Aha, aha!” be appalled at their own shame.
Context: David seeks the dismay of those who mock or delight in his misfortune.

Text: But may all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; may those who long for Your salvation always say, “The LORD be exalted!”
Context: A contrasting blessing for those who seek God, wishing them joy and praise.

Text: Yet I am poor and needy; may the Lord think of me. You are my help and my deliverer; O my God, do not delay.
Context: David acknowledges his own helplessness and expresses hope in God's timely intervention.

Text: Many are the woes of the wicked, but the LORD’s unfailing love surrounds the man who trusts in Him.
Context: A contrast between the plight of the wicked and the security of those who trust in God's love.

Text: Rejoice in the LORD and be glad, you righteous; sing, all you who are upright in heart!
Context: An exhortation to joy and singing directed at the righteous, with encouragement to maintain integrity of heart.
